page.paragraph: Now listen to a conversation between two students.
Hi, Will.
Oh, hi, Tess, sorry, I'm really tired.
You look tired. Why are you so tired? Didn't you sleep well last night?
I didn't sleep at all last night. I was up all night.
My goodness, why were you up all night?
I was studying.
All night?
Right.
You had so much studying to do that you couldn't sleep?
I had a big exam this morning, a physics exam.
Wasn't it hard to take a physics exam when you hadn't slept?
It sure was. I was really tired.
Did you do very well on the exam?
I don't know. I don't remember much of it, but I usually do pretty well.
Don't you think it would've been better to sleep before the exam?
But I couldn't. I had to study for the exam.
You didn't study before last night? You waited until last night to start studying?
Yeah, I waited until last night to start studying, and then I studied all night.
I couldn't do that. I need my sleep. I try to prepare some every night for a week or so before a big exam, and then I get a good night's sleep the night before the exam.
I'm not disciplined enough to do that.
Maybe you should work on this a little.
Maybe I should.
